Jargon Term: heart attack
two stents placed in your coronary arteries
started on dialysis
kidney failure
received 2 units of blood
anemia
Please go to all follow up appointments and take all medications as prescribed.
Annotation: Aftercare instructions - Upcoming Schedules - Specialist appointment

Jargon Term: Increase aspirin to 325mg daily for one month, then you may resume the 81mg daily dose.
Take clopdiogrel daily for one month to prevent clots in your stents.
Decreased your isosorbide MONOnitrate to isosorbide DInitrate 30mg three times daily.
Decreased your carvedilol to 6.25mg twice daily.
Increased your calcium acetate (Phoslo) to 2 tabs three times daily.
Started sevelamer, which helps prevent phosphate from becoming too high.
Stopped your oral iron (you will get this at dialysis).
Started nephrocaps, a vitamin for patients with kidney damage.
Started lisinopril, a blood pressure medicine that also helps the heart.
Changed omeprazole to pantoprazole, as this is less likely to interact with your heart medications.
Increased warfarin to 5mg daily as your blood test (INR) was not high enough on 2.5mg daily.
Weigh yourself every morning, [**Name8 (MD) 138**] MD if weight > 3 lbs.
Annotation: Aftercare instructions - patient needs to do - Other

Jargon Term: Adhere to 2 gm sodium diet.
Annotation: Aftercare instructions - patient needs to do - Diet

Jargon Term: If you experience chest pain or pressure, trouble breathing, fevers, chills, palpitations, lightheadedness, dizziness, or any other concerning symptoms, please seek medical attention or come to the ER immediately.
